<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Wilderness Spotter](/Feats.aspx?ID=868) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from The Fall of Plaguestone</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [The Fall of Plaguestone](/Sources.aspx?ID=3) pg. 57</row>

**Prerequisites**
Expert in [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16)

</column>

---

Select one type of terrain from the following list: aquatic, arctic, desert, forest, mountain, plains, sky, swamp, or underground. You can use [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) in place of Perception to roll initiative when in the selected terrain in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren’t tracking or otherwise using [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) before the encounter. You can also use [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in the chosen terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) instead of [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) to Disable the Device.

**Special** You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.

<title level="2">Noala's Training</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [The Fall of Plaguestone](/Sources.aspx?ID=3) pg. 56</row>

By aiding an NPC from The Fall of Plaguestone, the PCs can learn some special woodland survival techniques.

**Related Feats**: [Relentless Stalker](/Feats.aspx?ID=867)
name: Wilderness Spotter
